SENT.plain: Radionuclide and computed tomographic (CT) scans were reviewed in 215 patients with ischemic stroke
The findings vary depending on the site of vascular occlusion
In middle cerebral artery occlusion, four distinct patterns may be seen on the scintigrams
The CT scans show little variation in appearance
The tentorial confluence sign is an important finding on scintigrams of patients with occipital infarction; the absence of this signs should suggest another diagnosis
During the first week and after the fourth week following an ischemic stroke, the scintigram is usually negative, whereas the lesion is visible by CT
However, there are a significant number of false negative CT scans; therefore, both examinations are advocated in difficult cases
